caption.p: Average value effect on neural activity across all directional SEF neurons. The upper two rows show the effect of preferred and non-preferred direction target value on normalized neuronal activity in no-choice trials, and the lower two rows show their effect in choice trials. Within each set, the upper row (VPD) shows the effect of the preferred direction target value on normalized neural activity, whereas the lower row shows the effect of the non-preferred direction target value on normalized neural activity. Significance was calculated using a t-test, which shows whether the regression coefficient is significant difference from zero. The analysis corresponds to the results presented in Figure 4.
